commitResults.messageTitle: Use Java Streams API to simplify collection operations

commitResults.messageBody:
Assertions have been added throughout the codebase to document and
verify important assumptions that should hold during program execution.

Changes made:
- Parser: Verify index conversion from 1-based to 0-based is correct
- TaskList: Validate indices and non-null tasks before/after operations
- Task: Ensure state transitions are valid (mark/unmark operations)
- Storage: Verify data integrity during file I/O operations

These assertions help catch bugs early in development and serve as
executable documentation of code invariants. They will be disabled in
production builds for performance.

# Conflicts:
#	src/main/java/bob/storage/Storage.java
Branch a assertions

commitResults.messageBody: Add AI.md to document AI tool usage in project

commitResults.messageTitle: Enhance GUI with modern design and improved UX
commitResults.messageBody:
- Added CSS stylesheet for consistent styling
- Improved dialog boxes with rounded corners and shadows
- Enhanced color scheme with blue theme
- Increased window size to 450x600 for better visibility
- Updated welcome message to be more friendly
- Improved input field and button styling
- Added visual feedback on hover and focus states
- Fixed peek() assertion issue in Storage.java
Enhance GUI with modern design and improved UX

commitResults.messageTitle: Add personality to Bob: friendly and encouraging responses
commitResults.messageBody:
- Updated all UI messages with emojis and enthusiastic tone
- Made Bob more friendly, encouraging, and slightly humorous
- Added personality to welcome, exit, task operations, and search messages
- Bob now celebrates task completion and motivates users
- Updated both console UI and GUI messages consistently
- Messages now use emojis like ðŸ‘‹ ðŸŽ‰ âœ¨ ðŸ’ª ðŸš€ to add character
Add personality to Bob: friendly and encouraging responses

- Enhanced error messages with friendly, helpful language
- Added validation for empty descriptions after trimming
- Added validation for positive task numbers
- Added validation for event date logic (from date before to date)
- Added validation for empty date fields in deadlines and events
- Improved error messages in all command classes for save failures
- Updated UnknownCommand to suggest available commands
- All error messages now provide helpful examples and guidance

This addresses the A-MoreErrorHandling increment by:
1. Making error messages more user-friendly and informative
2. Adding edge case validation (empty strings, negative numbers, invalid date ranges)
3. Providing clear examples in error messages
4. Ensuring consistent error handling across all components
Add comprehensive error handling

Added extensive test coverage for all components:

Parser Tests (17 new tests):
- Edge cases: zero/negative task numbers, whitespace-only descriptions
- Empty field validation for deadlines and events
- Whitespace handling in dates and commands
- Large task number handling
- Date format edge cases

Task Tests (18 new tests):
- Event date validation (from date cannot be after to date)
- Multiple mark/unmark behavior with assertions
- Description preservation with special characters
- File format date preservation
- Type markers and formatting in toString/toFileString

TaskList Tests (20 new tests):
- Keyword search: case-insensitive, partial matching, all task types
- Sorting: alphabetical, case-insensitive, empty list, single task
- Sort preservation of completion status
- Boundary testing for date range searches
- Independent copy verification in getAllTasks
- Empty list and empty keyword edge cases

Storage Tests (15 new tests):
- Long descriptions and special characters
- Multiple sequential saves
- Task order preservation
- Many tasks handling (50+ tasks)
- Alternating task types
- Same start/end date for events
- File format separator validation
- Empty description edge case handling

Total: 70 new test cases added
All 137 tests passing

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve code quality: refactor Storage.load() using SLAP and update messages
commitResults.messageBody:
- Refactored Storage.load() method following SLAP principle
  - Extracted parseTaskFromLine() helper method
  - Extracted createTaskByType() to handle task type switching
  - Extracted createTodoTask(), createDeadlineTask(), createEventTask() for each task type
  - Extracted applyCompletionStatus() for marking tasks
  - Extracted validateLoadedTasks() for assertions
  - Reduced from 98 lines to ~30 lines with better abstraction

- Updated user-facing messages for consistency
  - Simplified UI messages in Ui.java
  - Updated Command classes with cleaner output
  - Updated MainWindow.java welcome message
  - Updated UnknownCommand.java error message

- Cleaned up error messages across codebase
  - More professional error message formatting
  - Consistent message style throughout application

All 85 tests passing after refactoring.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add comprehensive JavaDoc for all methods
commitResults.messageBody:
- Added JavaDoc for all private helper methods in Command classes
  - saveTasks(): saves tasks with error display
  - saveTasksQuiet(): saves tasks and throws exceptions

- Added JavaDoc for GUI classes
  - DialogBox: constructor and factory methods
  - Main: start() method
  - Launcher: main() method
  - MainWindow: setBob() method

- All 85 tests passing
- Follows assignment requirements for complete JavaDoc documentation
Add comprehensive unit tests (A-MoreTesting)
Improve code quality

- Change product name from Duke to Bob
- Add feature list showing Bob's capabilities
- Update setup instructions to use Launcher.java
- Remove Duke ASCII art and references
- Document GUI and CLI support

Completes final product preparation requirements.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add product website with user guide and UI screenshot
commitResults.messageBody:
- Created comprehensive user guide in docs/README.md
  - Detailed documentation for all features
  - Command examples with expected outputs
  - Quick start guide and command summary table
- Added Ui.png screenshot showing the product in use
  - Shows multiple task types (Todo, Deadline, Event)
  - Displays completed and pending tasks
  - Product name 'Bob' visible in window title
Improve code quality

- Add JavaFX native libraries for Linux, Mac, and Mac ARM64 to fat JAR
  - Previously only Windows natives were bundled, causing crash on Linux/Mac
  - JAR now includes win, linux, mac, mac-aarch64 platform classifiers
  - Resolves QuantumRenderer 'no suitable pipeline found' error

- Fix file encoding for cross-platform data compatibility
  - Use UTF-8 encoding explicitly in Storage save/load operations
  - Use consistent line endings (LF) instead of platform-dependent separators
  - Use try-with-resources for proper file handle cleanup

- Fix assertion crashes on legitimate user operations
  - Remove assertions in markAsDone/unmarkAsDone that crash on repeat operations
  - Users can now safely mark/unmark tasks multiple times

- Add null safety checks
  - Safe image loading in MainWindow with fallback for missing resources
  - Null/empty input guard in Bob.getResponse and MainWindow.handleUserInput
  - Trim todo description when loading from file

All 85 tests passing.
